review: So, I wanted to save some money and bought a "not-so-smart" display for my exercise room.  After all, I just needed something that would play television shows and movies off my Blu-ray player while I worked out on the treadmill.However, soon enough, I began running out of things to watch.It dawned on me that for that less than $10 per month, I could subscribe to one of the streaming services and have a wealth of content available at my fingertips.  However, since my television did not even have a wireless connection to support any streaming services it offered, I needed to find an accessory that could.Enter the Roku Streaming stick.  Significantly less money than the full-size device, which I did not need. I simply plugged the stick into one of the USB ports on the side of my display.  It has built-in wireless connectivity.  Upon startup, it found my wireless network.Once I registered the product, I signed up for a free month's trial of the most popular streaming service.  I was quite amazed to see how responsive Roku was to remote commands, moving through the streaming service content.  Starting a streamed television episode or movie was pretty instantaneous, with very little buffering delay.It's great that I didn't have to pay nearly twice the price for Apple TV or the full size Roku 3 to get the streaming options I wanted in this device.  It's very compact, yet very powerful.  It really has opened my world to obtaining far more content without having to actually purchase it.
author: Ronald Epstein "Ronald Epstein"
